text: I need to change a zip code into a series of dots and dashes (a barcode), but I can't figure out how
Here's what I've got so far:

code:
def encodeFive(zip):

    zero =  "||:::"

    one =   ":::||"

    two =   "::|:|"

    three = "::||:"

    four =  ":|::|"

    five =  ":|:|:"

    six =   ":||::"

    seven = "|:::|"

    eight = "|::|:"

    nine =  "|:|::"

    codeList = [zero,one,two,three,four,five,six,seven,eight,nine]

    allCodes = zero+one+two+three+four+five+six+seven+eight+nine

    code = ""
    digits = str(zip)
    for i in digits:

        code = code + i    

    return code

text: With this I'll get the original zip code in a string, but none of the numbers are encoded into the barcode.
I've figured out how to encode one number, but it wont work the same way with five numbers.
